description.language: Users will be prevented from changing all settings specified via MDM.
Users will be prevented from viewing the Admin Settings area.
All connection locations and locally stored data will be deleted.
Any startup password set in the app will be removed.

The URL of the remote connection. This takes one of these formats: smb://machineName/optionalShareAndPathName http://WebDAVMachineName/WebDAVRootPath https://WebDAVMachineName:WebDAVPortNumber/WebDAVRootPath ftp://FTPMachineName/FTPRootPath ftps://FTPSMachineName:Port/FTPRootPath skydrive:// gdrive:// dropbox:// box:// onepro://
A text string containing the description of the remote connection, used in the Locations tab of FileBrowser.
Optional. Leave as a blank string for cloud connections. For SMB connections, set this to the domain part of a UNC path, for example "local" or "company.com".
Optional. The account name for the connection. If there is no account name, this may be set to "<!-BLANK-->" which will prevent FileBrowser prompting the user for the name.

Optional. The password for the connection. Passwords should rarely need to be sent in settings. If there is no password, this may be set to "<!-BLANK-->" which will prevent FileBrowser prompting the user for the password.
Choose the type of the connection.
Optional. If using a VPN that can be automatically started when making a connection, enter the http address that will trigger the VPN.
Choose the type of VPN connection.
Optional. If using a connection with share enumeration disabled, you can enter a share name to connect here and/or after the machine's network name.

The URL of the remote connection. This takes one of these formats: smb://machineName/optionalShareAndPathName http://WebDAVMachineName/WebDAVRootPath https://WebDAVMachineName:WebDAVPortNumber/WebDAVRootPath ftp://FTPMachineName/FTPRootPath ftps://FTPSMachineName:Port/FTPRootPath skydrive:// gdrive:// dropbox:// box:// onepro://
A text string containing the description of the remote connection, used in the Locations tab of FileBrowser.
Optional. Leave as a blank string for cloud connections. For SMB connections, set this to the domain part of a UNC path, for example "local" or "company.com".
Optional. The account name for the connection. If there is no account name, this may be set to "<!-BLANK-->" which will prevent FileBrowser prompting the user for the name.

Optional. The password for the connection. Passwords should rarely need to be sent in settings. If there is no password, this may be set to "<!-BLANK-->" which will prevent FileBrowser prompting the user for the password.
Choose the type of the connection.
Optional. If using a VPN that can be automatically started when making a connection, enter the http address that will trigger the VPN.
Choose the type of VPN connection.
Optional. If using a connection with share enumeration disabled, you can enter a share name to connect here and/or after the machine's network name.
The convenience name of the bookmark as it will appear in the list.
The server name. For cloud connections this is the display name of the connection so that it can be uniquely identified. For local connections this is "localhost".
The share name. Leave empty for connections without shares.
The path may contain multiple path components separated by forward slashes.
If the bookmark is for a file rather than a folder, this setting is the file"s name.
Choose the type of bookmark.
The convenience name of the bookmark as it will appear in the list.
The server name. For cloud connections this is the display name of the connection so that it can be uniquely identified. For local connections this is "localhost".
The share name. Leave empty for connections without shares.
The path may contain multiple path components separated by forward slashes.
If the bookmark is for a file rather than a folder, this setting is the file"s name.
Choose the type of bookmark.
Background sync will be prevented when not on a WiFi network.
Start with the display name of the location and then the path to the file or folder.
Select this option if the desired location is a folder. The complete folder contents will be synchronised.
Start with the display name of the location and then the path to the file or folder.
Select this option if the desired location is a folder. The complete folder contents will be synchronised.
Start with the display name of the location and then the path to the file or folder.
Select this option if the desired location is a folder. The complete folder contents will be synchronised.
The blue tips button will be prevented from appearing.
After selecting files/folders and choosing Copy/Move, the help popup will be omitted if this option is selected.
File names longer than can be displayed on the screen will be scrolled from left to right.
Tapping on a document will open a viewer with a Print option. This swaps the View/Print menu option with the action on tapping a document.
When in Grid View mode, viewing folders contents as icons, show a menu button for each file. If this option is disabled then a long tap is needed to bring up a file menu.
When opening a file on remote storage, always re-load it and ignore any cached data.

When opening a folder, images and videos can be automatically be given a thumbnail image. The On Screen option only creates thumbnails for the files visible on screen. The All Files option will create them for every image/video in a folder.
More thumbnails means that network data to re-calculate them is reduced, but additional local memory will be used to store them.
When opening an audio file for playback, embedded tags for track metadata and thumbnails will not be extracted.
When opening an audio file, always start playing from the start. Leave this unchecked to start playback from the last play position.
iPhone only: When tapping an audio file, the view will switch to the Audio tab.
Changes the audio queueing behaviour when tapping on an audio file.

option.language: Play remaining audio in folder once
Play all files in folder on repeat
Shuffle play all files in folder

description.language: Display the video filename when video controls are displayed.
Use the current slideshow mode (repeat/random) to start playing the next video in a folder once the current video finishes.
From 0 to 3600 seconds.
The password that the WebDAV server and web server in the app uses to verify a remote user.

label.language: Prevent WebDAV Server From Sharing Machines

description.language: Enter display names for locations prevented from being shared over WebDAV. Separate the names using '/'.
Includes files with the Hidden file system attribute and files whose names start with a period.

label.language: On App Start Jump to Last Folder
Clear Cached Files on App Exit
Prevent My Files Being Included in iTunes/iCloud Backup
Keep Full Size Images in OneDrive
View Google Docs in Native Viewer
Default User Name for New Locations

description.language: Used only when a user tries to create a new machine location to connect to.
Used only when a user tries to create a new machine location to connect to.

label.language: Allow Future Logins to Re-use Credentials

description.language: Used in a post-startup popup.
Used in a post-startup popup.
In megabytes.
